intro: Pneumatopteris boridensis, commonly known as the northern water fern, is a rare and ancient fern species native to the mountainous regions of eastern Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, floating fronds that are adapted to aquatic environments. The plant has a unique reproductive system, with spores produced in specialized structures called sori. Its leaves are typically bipinnate, with a feathery appearance that aids in maximizing surface area for photosynthesis. Due to habitat loss and environmental changes, Pneumatopteris boridensis is considered endangered and is of great interest to botanists studying evolutionary adaptations in aquatic flora.
